problem: A circle with radius 5 cm is rotated about its center by 180 degrees. What is the total area covered by the circle during the rotation?
solution: The area covered by the circle during the rotation is the same as the area of the circle, because a 180-degree rotation maps each point on the circle onto another point on the circle itself. The area of the circle is given by $A = \pi \times \text{radius}^2$. Substituting the radius of 5 cm, we get $A = \pi \times 5^2 = 25\pi$ cm$^2$. Therefore, the total area covered during the rotation is $25\pi$ cm$^2$. \(\boxed{25\pi}\)
